Third coefficient β_2 on the variable window size function
Shape of the window, either circular or square

the starting height above ground at which layer divisions begin

window radius for the first local maximum filter for detecting tree tops
size of the buffer enforced around each point to create a polygonal cluster
logical switch, where False adds weight to clusters to account for mid-canopy density in conifer stands
window radius for the second local maximum filter for detecting tree tops

Resolution of the CHM
The eliminating layer in the original paper is defined as a layer of `layer_thickness` m below the current CHM. Refer to Eysn 2015 p. 1728).
2D threshold for delineating a tree from local maximum. A tree is created if no other detected tree lies within this distance
3D threshold for delineating a tree from local maximum. A tree is created if no other detected tree lies within this distance
Number of nearest neighbors to use in search. Refer to Vega (2014).
Tested values: All forward and reverse permutations of the sequence: {5, 6, 7, 8, 10, 12, 15, 20, 25, 30, 40, 60, 80, 100}

Description: Minimum height of a detected tree. Addition not in the original paper included to reduce oversegmentation.

radius of circles used to rasterize the point cloud to CHM
Size of kernel to smoothe CHM before applying watershed algorithm
Minimum Z distance between a tree candidate's highest point and the point where it contacts another tree. If Z distance < tolerance, the object is merged with its highest neighbor.
Search radius in pixels for neighboring trees
